required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Factors Affecting ADR of Screening Colonoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Comprehensive Analysis of Multilevel Factors Affecting Adenoma Detection Rates of Screening Colonoscopy

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the impact of multilevel factors on the quality of screening colonoscopy, reflected mainly by adenoma detection rate (ADR).

detailed_description.textblock: The subjects will include patients who need to screening colonoscopies by 21 endoscopists between January 2019 and December 2019 were retrospectively enrolled in this unit. Multilevel factors, including patient-, proceduralist-, and procedure-level characteristics were analyzed for the relationship with ADR.

primary_outcome.time_frame: After histopathologically examined, reviewed, and confirmed, an average of 7 days.
primary_outcome.description: the proportion of colonoscopies in which at least one adenoma was detected

study_pop.textblock: Endoscopy Department of a university Hospital

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

facility.name: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang Chinese Medical University

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data sharing will be consider after study
